title: Saturday Night Live 40th anniversary graphics
content:
I saw a 40th anniversary title card for Saturday Night Live on the Hulu website today, and I couldn't figure out which condensed (or compressed) industrial typeface it is. It's not quite Knockout from Hoefler & Co. or Helvetica Ultra Compressed. The telltale letters are "S," "A," "R," and "G."

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101359im_/http:/typophile.com/files/snl-40_5952.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [snl-40.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101359/http:/typophile.com/files/snl-40.jpg) | 100.11 KB |
author: kctuskey

comments.content:
Closest I could find was Fusion Sans by Parachute, but like Knockout and Helvetica Ultra Compressed, it’s not quite right:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/parachute/pf-fusion-sans-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101359/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/parachute/pf-fusion-sans-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/parachute/pf-fusion-sans-pro/")

Custom version of [Druk Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101359/http:/commercialtype.com/typefaces/druk) by Berton Hasebe commissioned by Pentagram and exclusive for Saturday Night Live - [http://commercialtype.com/news/updates/custom\_version\_of\_druk\_for\_snl](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101359/http:/commercialtype.com/news/updates/custom_version_of_druk_for_snl "http://commercialtype.com/news/updates/custom\_version\_of\_druk\_for\_snl")
